{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the given information, the swelling in the maxillary LI region is hot, palpable, and rebounds on pressure. This suggests the presence of an abscess. The treatment of choice for an abscess is incision and drainage. Antibiotic coverage may be necessary after the procedure, but it is not the primary treatment. Antibiotics alone without drainage would not effectively treat the abscess. Aspiration may provide temporary relief, but it is not the definitive treatment for an abscess.", "answer_choice": "A. Incision & drainage"}
